intro: Aerangis biloboides, commonly known as the Bilobed Orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), while its flowers are usually white or pale pink with a distinctive bilobed lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
